response.answer_text: Digital Surveillance is the monitoring of PC movement, information put away on a hard drive, or being exchanged through PC systems. Digital observation is normally done superstitiously and should be possible by anybody, government, companies and even people. While it’s true many governments around the world spy on their citizens, the U.S. is one of the most advanced. The majority of Americans have no idea how widespread their monitoring has become. Televisions, smartphones, even software—all of these things are now vulnerable to CIA and NSA hacking Know More:
